results.title: Aunjanue Ellis Leans Into a Supporting Role and Turns It Into a Talker
results.abstract: The actress is used to secondary parts, but with “King Richard” she is being singled out for her turn as the mother of Venus and Serena Williams.

multimedia.caption: “The wife of the hero can be utterly boring to play,” said Aunjanue Ellis, who found the role of Oracene Price in “King Richard” more interesting than that.

results.title: This Movie Season, It’s a Black-and-White Boom
results.abstract: “Passing,” “The Tragedy of Macbeth” and “Belfast” are just a few of the movies that forgo color for a more classical approach.

results.title: Art Houses Want Audiences Back. Can a MoviePass-Style Program Help?
results.abstract: Mubi Go, which has debuted in New York, allows cinephiles to watch one movie per week at a theater — and also stream hundreds of handpicked films from home.

results.title: When Women Filmmakers Get to Tell Their Origin Stories
results.abstract: Movies about men who make movies are common, but female auteurs don’t often get such chances. That’s just one reason two new releases are so surprising.

results.title: Lawyers for ‘Rust’ Armorer Say Gun Was Briefly Unattended Before Shooting
results.abstract: The weapon handed to Alec Baldwin was left on a tray for several minutes, said the lawyers. Earlier, they had said it had been unattended for hours.

multimedia.caption: Lawyers for the armorer, who administered guns on the set of “Rust,” a film to star Alec Baldwin, said that the gun that fatally discharged on the set was left unattended for five to ten minutes.

results.title: ‘Maybe I Do Have a Story to Tell’: Kal Penn on His Memoir
results.abstract: The actor talks about his new book, “You Can’t Be Serious,” in which he introduces readers to his fiancé, Josh, and explains his sabbatical from Hollywood to work for the Obama administration.

results.title: Talking About ‘Attica,’ the Newest Documentary on the Prison Uprising
results.abstract: Fifty years after the fact, the filmmakers Stanley Nelson and Traci A. Curry reflect on the bloody standoff and what it accomplished.

results.title: ‘Rust’ Armorer Has ‘No Idea’ How Live Rounds Got on Set, Lawyers Say
results.abstract: Hannah Gutierrez-Reed was in charge of firearms on the New Mexico film set where Alec Baldwin fatally shot a cinematographer with a gun that was not supposed to contain live ammunition.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Simon Romero

multimedia.caption: The movie set in New Mexico where a cinematographer was shot and killed with a gun that the actor Alec Baldwin had been rehearsing with. The crew had said the gun was safe, but it turned out to be loaded with live ammunition.

results.title: A Filmmaking Life Gets a Sequel
results.abstract: Joanna Hogg is the rare director to be given the greenlight for a two-part drama about finding her own voice. She’s only been thinking about it since 1988.

multimedia.caption: Joanna Hogg said she initially planned to shoot both parts of “The Souvenir” at the same time because “there was a danger that if I just made the first one, I wouldn’t get the opportunity to make the second one.”

results.title: Sean Penn the Focus of N.L.R.B. Amid Comments on Hours and Food at Vaccine Site
